programme.title: Fish or Die
programme.desc: Four friends and die-hard anglers set out to be the first to fish the most remote waters in the world. They begin with a gruelling jungle expedition to investigate rumours of a golden dorado, a large predatory fish, following migrating baitfish up an uncharted Bolivian river

programme.desc: NASCAR Champion Ryan Newman gets ATM to make a desk aquarium, and Boston Red Sox star Shane Victorino asks the brothers-in-law to build a Hawaiian themed tank

programme.desc: Robert follows in his fathers steps wrangling Utah, a highly venomous king cobra. A vet from the zoos hospital, Dr Amber, visits Tandora to care for wild koalas

programme.title: Pit Bulls and Parolees
programme.desc: A request for help takes a tragic turn when Tia helps a man care for two dogs he rescued. Meanwhile, a volunteer at Villalobos steps up to adopt a canine with an unusual past

programme.title: My Cat from Hell
programme.desc: Behaviourist Jackson Galaxy returns to help beleaguered owners tame their boisterous felines. He meets skydiver Jacques, who owns two ferocious Savannah cats, and Bijan and Heather, who are being driven apart by the territorial Wolfie

programme.title: My Cat from Hell
programme.desc: Behaviourist Jackson Galaxy helps a firefighter in Los Angeles who is struggling to deal with a crazy cat, while a Texan couple are disturbed by their kittys night-time terrors

programme.title: Lone Star Law
programme.desc: Two rookies from the 59th cadet class of Texas Game Wardens work their first cases. The search is on for a hunter lost in the Big Thicket Preserve in East Texas

programme.title: Dr Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: A golden retriever is rushed into surgery after swallowing a childs dummy, and then the team step in to save a stray dog that has been hit by a car in Oklahoma

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Pete Nelson builds a treetop fortress for a couple who loves all things medieval. Features include a high tower with a round table and thrones, and a loft with a glass floor

programme.title: Guardians of Rescue
programme.desc: Group founder Rob and investigators Marceline, Bill and Elle try to unmask a puppy flipper. Brian and Face look for a dog in a mechanics hoard

programme.title: Alaska: The Last Frontier
programme.desc: Eivin and Eves cannibal hen strikes again, while Atz begins his summer riding season so he can protect Ottos cattle herd by keeping the predators at bay

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People
programme.desc: Noah invents an ingenious device to rid their homesite of moles. Billy gives daughter Rain major responsibility as barn construction goes full bore at the ranch

programme.title: Inside Museums
programme.desc: Artist Lachlan Goudie visits the Scottish National Gallery in Edinburgh to explore the relevance of a much-loved collection, to the challenges people face today in terms of family, community and nature

programme.title: Meet the Ancestors
programme.desc: Following amateur archaeologists as they undertake the largest-ever excavation of the World War One battlefield at Ypres in Flanders, uncovering an incredible array of artefacts either forgotten or discarded at the end of the conflict. The programme reveals remarkably well-preserved infrastructures of trenches and dug-outs, as well as poignant personal reminders of the human cost involved

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc: A look back at the career of the Oscar-winning actor through interviews conducted with the BBC. Hopkins talks about his approach to acting, his years as a hellraiser, and the films that helped make him a star, including Remains of the Day, Shadowlands, Nixon, and The Silence of the Lambs, in which he first portrayed his most celebrated character, Dr Hannibal Lecter. Sylvia Syms narrates

programme.title: The Remains of the Day
programme.desc: A butler in a 1930s aristocratic household has dedicated himself to serving his master, putting duty above all else and repressing his affection for the housekeeper, who also happens to be in love with him. On the outbreak of war, the noblemans Nazi sympathies come to light, marking a change of heart in the old servant, who looks back with misgivings about the loyalty that may have cost him dearly. Period drama, with Anthony Hopkins, Emma Thompson and James Fox

programme.title: Letter to Brezhnev
programme.desc: Soviet sailors Peter and Sergei go ashore in Liverpool to spend a night on the town. When Peter falls for local woman Elaine, their parting inspires a letter to the Soviet General Secretary. Director Chris Bernards Bafta-nominated comedy drama, starring Peter Firth, Alfred Molina and Alexandra Pigg

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc: A look back at the career of the Oscar-winning actor through interviews conducted with the BBC. Hopkins talks about his approach to acting, his years as a hellraiser, and the films that helped make him a star, including Remains of the Day, Shadowlands, Nixon, and The Silence of the Lambs, in which he first portrayed his most celebrated character, Dr Hannibal Lecter. Sylvia Syms narrates

programme.title: Meet the Ancestors
programme.desc: Following amateur archaeologists as they undertake the largest-ever excavation of the World War One battlefield at Ypres in Flanders, uncovering an incredible array of artefacts either forgotten or discarded at the end of the conflict. The programme reveals remarkably well-preserved infrastructures of trenches and dug-outs, as well as poignant personal reminders of the human cost involved

programme.title: The Making of King Arthur
programme.desc: Poet Simon Armitage traces the evolution of the Arthurian legend through the literature of the medieval age, revealing that King Arthur is not the great national hero he is usually considered to be. He is a fickle and transitory character who was appropriated by the Normans to justify their conquest; he was cuckolded when French writers began adapting the story; and it took Thomas Malorys masterpiece of English literature, Le Mort dArthur, to restore his dignity and reclaim him as the national hero known today

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Kate Thornton presents an edition first broadcast September 18, 1998. Includes performances by All Saints, Aerosmith, Pulp, Alishas Attic and Honeyz

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Jayne Middlemiss presents the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 25 September 1998. Featuring Jennifer Paige, Lutricia McNeal, The Divine Comedy, Aerosmith, Deetah, Eels, PJ Harvey and Melanie B feat Missy Elliott

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Mike Read presents an edition first broadcast on November 1, 1979. Featuring performances by Sparks, the Ramblers, Darts, the Jam, Lene Lovich, Thin Lizzy, Suzi Quatro, BA Robertson and Lena Martell. Plus, dance sequences by Legs and Co

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Mark Goodier and Nicky Campbell present the edition first aired on November 3 1988. Featuring performances by Gloria Estefan and Miami Sound Machine, Robert Palmer, Tanita Tikaram, Bryan Ferry, Robin Beck, Kylie Minogue, Yazz, Enya and Guns N Roses

programme.title: Eurythmics at the BBC
programme.desc: Dave Stewart and Annie Lennoxs synthpop group were one of the biggest British acts of the 1980s, being bold, innovative, stylish and always highly unpredictable. The pair first tasted chart success in the Tourists before breaking away and achieving international stardom with songs like Love Is a Stranger and Sisters Are Doin It for Themselves, and their evolving look and sound are captured here in a collection of best moments from the BBCs music archives

programme.title: Annie Lennox at the BBC
programme.desc: A selection of the singer-songwriters finest performances plucked from the BBC archives, celebrating the solo side of her accomplishments, which started in earnest with the release of her hugely acclaimed debut solo album Diva in 1992. Since then she has shown time and time again exactly why she remains one of the nations most popular and critically praised artists, as is evidence in this selection of her finest performances plucked from the BBC archives

programme.title: Annie Lennox: BBC One Sessions
programme.desc: The Academy Award-winning singer performs at LSO St Lukes, London, with members of the BBC Concert Orchestra. The session includes songs from the Eurythmics back catalogue, together with material from her solo career. First shown in 2009

programme.title: Annie Lennox: Diva
programme.desc: Andrea Miller interviews the Eurythmics star, who talks about her life and her personal and musical relationship with Dave Stewart. The programme also features an extensive selection of archive footage

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Kate Thornton presents an edition first broadcast September 18, 1998. Includes performances by All Saints, Aerosmith, Pulp, Alishas Attic and Honeyz

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Jayne Middlemiss presents the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 25 September 1998. Featuring Jennifer Paige, Lutricia McNeal, The Divine Comedy, Aerosmith, Deetah, Eels, PJ Harvey and Melanie B feat Missy Elliott

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Mark Goodier and Nicky Campbell present the edition first aired on November 3 1988. Featuring performances by Gloria Estefan and Miami Sound Machine, Robert Palmer, Tanita Tikaram, Bryan Ferry, Robin Beck, Kylie Minogue, Yazz, Enya and Guns N Roses

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Gethin Jones and Kym Marsh present the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical discussion and expert advice for viewers

programme.title: Crimewatch Caught
programme.desc: How criminals making millions selling counterfeit cigarettes were caught hiding their stash in secret drawers. Plus, a drugs courier who claimed to have won £200,000 gambling. Narrated by Rav Wilding

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts has a friendly disagreement with a developer about what to do at a Northampton flat. Jacqui Joseph is in Norwich, where theres potential to convert a former shop into a flat. Dion Dublin is in Stoke-on-Trent, where new windows are part of a long to-do list

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Under the expert guidance of Catherine Southon and Mark Stacey, father and daughter Hash and Jaymeesha take on mother and son Jenny and Dan, scouring an antiques fair in Detling, Kent, for items to sell for profit at auction in Portsmouth. Eric Knowles monitors the contest and also visits a museum in Maidstone thats home to a unique collection of horse-drawn vehicles and transport-related treasure

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Scam Interceptors
programme.sub-title: We Have Eyes on the Scammers
programme.desc: The ground team are scrambled in a desperate bid to stop a woman letting her mobile phone account be used to buy the fraudsters a new, top-of-the-range handset

programme.title: Lost and Found in the Lakes
programme.desc: The team members dive at an underwater dumping ground to salvage a long-lost motorbike, clean up Helvellyn and remove and recycle dangerous items from all over the Lake District. Presenter Helen Skelton also reveals the behind-the-scenes secrets from the series searches and some of the dubious items that perhaps should have remained lost

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton heads to the Highlands of Scotland to advise an artistic couple, whose aspirations include starting their own music festival among the magnificent mountains the region is famous for. Alistair also visits an ambitious rewilding project which hopes to restore the once vast Caledonian Forest

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Lee Burkhill are in Crawley, West Sussex, to convert Lamar and Nadines overgrown, weed-filled garden into a tropical social space. They would love the garden to draw on their combined Jamaican and Myanmar heritage, as well as Sri Lanka, so its an eclectic mix of semi-tropical planting, socialising spaces and a central cooking area where all the action would take place

programme.title: The Inner Circle
programme.desc: Amanda Holden hosts the quiz show where players must outsmart each other to win big. Six players are each randomly assigned a secret amount, which could be anything from zero to £4,000, before being thrown into a battle of wits, nerve and strategic gameplay across a series of challenging rounds

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which four pairs of contestants have to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Phil Wang

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones, Scott Mills and a team of roving reporters present topical stories from around the UK

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Kat orchestrates a meeting with Zoe and Anthony as she worries about her daughters welfare, Nicola tries to build bridges with George, and Patrick and Kim grow suspicious of Anthonys clandestine behaviour

programme.title: Celebrity Race Across the World
programme.desc: Each accompanied by a partner or family member, broadcaster Roman Kemp, actor Dylan Llewellyn, broadcaster and writer Anita Rani, actress and singer Molly Rainford embark on an epic 5,900km race through the entirety of Central America. The race begins on Isla Mujeres, the easternmost point of Mexico and a sacred island of the Maya. The four pairs must pass through five checkpoints to reach the finish line in Península de la Guajira, the northernmost region of South America

programme.title: The Celebrity Traitors
programme.desc: As the ultimate game of deception and trust draws to a close, the stakes have never been higher as the celebrity players face their final, explosive mission. With the prize fund complete, will the pressure of winning cloud anyones vision? Will the famous faithful banish all the traitors to secure victory, or will the traitors manage to deceive until the bitter end? Hosted by Claudia Winkleman

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of todays headlines

programme.title: The View
programme.desc: Mark Carruthers reviews the weeks political news, including reports on the latest events at Stormont and Westminster. Plus, comment and analysis with studio guests

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate from Sunderland. On the panel are Chair of the Labour Party Anna Turley MP, Conservative and former Energy Minister Graham Stuart MP, General Secretary of the TUC Paul Nowak and the Daily Telegraph columnist Tim Stanley

programme.title: Newscast
programme.desc: A panel of BBC journalists hosts a weekly round-up from Westminster, delivering the usual mix of serious analysis and light-hearted gossip about the biggest stories in politics. Laura Kuenssberg, Adam Fleming and Chris Mason are among the regular contributors

programme.title: The Celebrity Inner Circle
programme.desc: Amanda Holden hosts the quiz show, with Chizzy Akudolu, JJ Chalmers, Charlie Hedges, Susie McCabe, Melvin Odoom and Hasan Semay paired with six contestants. Each pair is randomly assigned a secret stash of cash, before being thrown into a battle of wits, nerve and strategic gameplay

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical discussion and expert advice for viewers, with JJ Chalmers and Kym Marsh

programme.title: Crimewatch Caught
programme.desc: How a gang illegally digging up roads to divert electricity to power dozens of cannabis farms was caught. Plus, the shoddy builder who took £35,000 from an unwitting victim. Narrated by Rav Wilding

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell keep an eye on three property renovations in Havant in Hampshire, Sutton-in-Ashfield in Nottinghamshire and Brighton. Two of the developers start their projects thinking they might make their auction buys their homes, though it remains possible that valuations at the end of the projects will make them change their minds

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp presents as two family duos are challenged to scour an antiques fair and pick up bargains to sell for profit at auction in Heanor, Derbyshire. Mother and daughter Kate and Ellie, guided by antiques expert Irita Marriott, compete against grandmother and grandson Carole and Tom, skippered by expert John Cameron. Natasha keeps tabs on events and in the workshop of historical costumier Ninya Mikhaila, learns about the techniques used to decorate Tudor garments, including one called pinking

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: BBC Newsline; Weather
programme.desc: Local news worth watching from across Northern Ireland

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Hope Street
programme.desc: When a local head teacher is threatened, new boy Donal takes charge of the investigation - and Chloe worries that her secret boyfriend is the culprit. Lois spots Luke with a woman and warns Eve to take care of her marriage, leaving Eve wondering if he is having an affair. Lois has problems of her own as she faces a health scare. Elsewhere, Clint refuses to give Brandi her job back, so Nicole concocts a cunning plan. Tara Lynne ONeill stars

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman helps a couple from Scotland to find a characterful cottage in the Cotswolds with a £600,000 budget. While in the region, Nicki drops in on show jumping legend and double Olympic gold medallist Nick Skelton and his sons Harry and Dan, who are following in their fathers footsteps

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Lee Burkhill and Flo Headlam head to Winchester, Hampshire, to transform Stefan and Lucindas unloved plot into a garden inspired by their love of making meals outdoors. The pair want to see a kitchen in the garden and a spot to grow produce that they can cook on a barbecue. All this needs to be achieved on a £6,000 budget

programme.title: The Inner Circle
programme.desc: Amanda Holden hosts the quiz show where players must outsmart each other to win big. Six players are each randomly assigned a secret amount, which could be anything from zero to £4,000, before being thrown into a battle of wits, nerve and strategic gameplay across a series of challenging rounds

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which four pairs of contestants have to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Phil Wang

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Clara Amfo and Alex Jones host the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: Farm 999
programme.sub-title: Fields of Danger as Farmer Is Impaled and Eagles Threaten Highland Flocks
programme.desc: Documentary following the police, fire and ambulance services as they attend emergency situations in rural communities. The East Anglian Air Ambulance races to save a farmer after a freak accident, lambs face attack from birds of prey, and reporter Paul Colgan investigates illegal fly-tipping in Cheshire. Featuring accounts from first responders, community members and farmers at the centre of these emergencies

programme.title: Return to Paradise
programme.desc: Mackenzie Clarke gets VIP access to the chart-topping band Point Ruins reunion concert, when one of their members is murdered in the green room. But with all the suspects on stage at the time, how could the killer have done it? Away from the murder, Glenn and Daisy send out invitations to their wedding, and Mackenzie has to deal with her feelings when shes not invited

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Katherine Ryan hosts as comedian Maisie Adam and journalist Lewis Goodall join team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop to delve into the weeks news

programme.title: How Are You? Its Alan (Partridge)
programme.desc: Finding himself back where he began, Alan is forced to wonder if he has come full circle or gone nowhere, before a tragic death leads to a moment of quite staggering catharsis. Comedy, starring Steve Coogan, with Felicity Montagu and Dan Tetsell

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of todays headlines

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: The host is joined by Hollywood star Glen Powell who is appearing in dystopian action thriller The Running Man. Also on the sofa are Oscar-winner Michelle Yeoh, who is playing Madame Morrible in Wicked: For Good, Emmy-winning Brit Rosamund Pike, currently in crime caper sequel Now You See Me: Now You Dont and comedian-actor Jack Whitehall, one of the stars of tense thriller series Malice. Plus, Ed Sheeran chats and performs Camera, from his current album Play

programme.title: RuPauls Drag Race UK
programme.desc: RuPaul presents the Snatch game with a new twist, which sees the queens showcase their best celebrity dating and improvisation skills as they fight for the affections of broadcaster Jordan North in a special edition of Snatch Me Out. Michelle Visage and Alan Carr are joined in the panel by comedy actress Susan Wokoma

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous: The Movie
programme.desc: Worried about her finances when her book fails to find a publisher, Patsy is given the tip that Kate Moss has left her PR company and will be looking for new representation. Things start to go awry when the plot to approach the model goes horribly wrong and Patsy and Edina find themselves vilified by the entire nation and have to flee the country. Comedy based on the BBC sitcom, starring Jennifer Saunders, Joanna Lumley and Julia Sawalha

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: Doctors Chris and Xand van Tulleken join Rattus for a selection of old and new sketches relating to bodies. Including a Viking makeover, why one shouldnt hold excessive wind in and the Victorian steam-powered gyms

programme.title: The Hit List
programme.desc: Marvin and Rochelle Humes present the music-based quiz show, with father and son Ronnie and Marc from Glasgow, colleagues Fi and Georgie from London and married couple Kate and Nick from Hertfordshire competing for a possible £10,000 jackpot. Across three rounds, their knowledge is put to the test, as they attempt to identify huge hits from across the years. Whether its a song from the swinging 60s or the number-one track in todays charts, the teams must prove their ability to recognise songs from all genres of music - from pop to country, rock to RandB and many more

programme.title: Alan Carrs Picture Slam
programme.desc: Alan Carr hosts this game show in which three teams of contestants have to identify a board full of images, with a chance of winning up to £10,000 if they know them all. Playing this week are a married couple from Liverpool, and two pairs of friends from Birmingham and Aberdeen

programme.title: RuPauls Drag Race UK
programme.desc: RuPaul presents the Snatch game with a new twist, which sees the queens showcase their best celebrity dating and improvisation skills as they fight for the affections of broadcaster Jordan North in a special edition of Snatch Me Out. Michelle Visage and Alan Carr are joined in the panel by comedy actress Susan Wokoma

programme.title: Cat Person
programme.desc: A student begins dating an older man and realises that his persona in real-life doesnt match his flirty texts. Tense drama, starring Emilia Jones, Nicholas Braun and Geraldine Viswanathan

programme.title: Behind Bars: Sex, Bribes and Murder
programme.desc: Part one of two. After a video featuring a female prison officer and an inmate having sex inside HMP Wandsworth goes viral, journalist Mobeen Azhar begins an investigation into what happened and why. A year of twists, turns and damning revelations pulls back the curtain on a dangerous wider world of coercion, corruption and contraband thriving behind bars

programme.title: Behind Bars: Sex, Bribes and Murder
programme.desc: Part two of two. Mobeen Azhars investigation into prison corruption uncovers the murder of a former officer who had been involved in exposing an illicit relationship. When news breaks of a prison governor being jailed for a relationship with a drug-dealing gang boss, Mobeen becomes determined to uncover the true extent of criminal influence inside our prisons

programme.title: BBC New Comedy Awards
programme.desc: The Boiler Shop arts and performance space in Newcastle is the venue for the fourth heat, which sees comics Charlie Ashton, Murph, Zoe Cousin, Caira OConnor and Shugufta Choudhry battling it out to book their place in this years grand final in Bradford. Amy Gledhill hosts the proceedings and the judges for the night are Teesside local Phil Dunning, former winner Dan Tiernan and head judge Fatiha El-Ghorri

programme.title: BBC Comedy Short Films
programme.desc: On a Bradford estate, Lenny and Mullet find an abandoned car and turn it into a DIY spaceship. Elif Riley, Logan Ludbrook, Lucy Francis and Hayley Brown star in this kitchen-sink sci-fi comedy about big dreams, everyday lives and escaping without going anywhere

programme.title: RuPauls Drag Race UK
programme.desc: RuPaul presents the Snatch game with a new twist, which sees the queens showcase their best celebrity dating and improvisation skills as they fight for the affections of broadcaster Jordan North in a special edition of Snatch Me Out. Michelle Visage and Alan Carr are joined in the panel by comedy actress Susan Wokoma

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: Strictly Come Dancing judge Shirley Ballas joins Rattus for a waltz through the history of dance, with Bruno Tonioli as Nero, who had his dance teacher killed, and Queen Victorias Highland reel

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: Charles Darwin hosts a timely look at how humans have treated the planet throughout history. With Henry VIII, the inventor of the plastic bag and Judge Rinder

programme.title: The Catch Up
programme.desc: A round-up of the days news

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and Richard Hammond take charge of shooting a car chase for a film version of The Sweeney, assisting with the stunt-driving choreography and the direction of lead actors Ray Winstone and Ben Drew. James May takes the Vauxhall Corsa VXR Nurburgring for a run around the test track, and delivers his verdict on the updated Fiat Panda. Hollywood actor Ryan Reynolds is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Joe Swash: Forgotten Young Dads
programme.desc: Joe meets young dads who are navigating the highs and lows of fatherhood, looking back on his own experiences as a parent and sparking wider conversations about masculinity, the importance of positive male role models, and why its time for young dads to be seen, heard, supported - and celebrated. Reflecting on how becoming a father in his mid-twenties changed his life, he meets four young dads who, like he once did, are navigating the challenges of parenting and are determined to challenge stigma, overcome hardship and redefine what fatherhood looks like today

programme.title: Celebrity Race Across the World
programme.desc: Each accompanied by a partner or family member, broadcaster Roman Kemp, actor Dylan Llewellyn, broadcaster and writer Anita Rani, actress and singer Molly Rainford embark on an epic 5,900km race through the entirety of Central America. The race begins on Isla Mujeres, the easternmost point of Mexico and a sacred island of the Maya. The four pairs must pass through five checkpoints to reach the finish line in Península de la Guajira, the northernmost region of South America

programme.title: The Man Who Murdered His Family
programme.desc: The story of the life and downfall of Grant Amato, whose obsession with an internet cam model led to betrayal, financial ruin and murder. He enjoyed a life of success and privilege before his infactuation took grip

programme.title: The Man Who Murdered His Family
programme.desc: Grant Amato is on trial for his life, and the evidence is piling up against him while the media focuses on cam model Silvie as the key to the case

programme.title: The Man Who Murdered His Family
programme.desc: Grant Amato becomes famous after his case goes viral. Film director Colin Archdeacon travels to Bulgaria in the hope of finding the one person who may hold the answers to this mystery. After years of claiming his innocence, Amato reveals stunning new information about the murders that sends police on a mad dash to uncover the truth

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and Richard Hammond take charge of shooting a car chase for a film version of The Sweeney, assisting with the stunt-driving choreography and the direction of lead actors Ray Winstone and Ben Drew. programme.title: Missing in Paradise: Searching for Sarm
programme.desc: Journalist Tir Dhondy investigates the disappearance of Sarm Heslop, who went missing from a luxury Caribbean charter yacht in 2021. Tire retraces Sarms last known movements and tracks down two boat captains whose vessels were moored near the yacht she vanished from. Also, she gets to question Ryan Banes, Sarms boyfriend, account of what happened what happened through his lawyer David Cattie

programme.title: Missing in Paradise: Searching for Sarm
programme.desc: Tir Dhondy meets with island police and is given CCTV footage that has never been released, showing Sarms last known movements with her boyfriend, Ryan Bane

programme.title: Missing in Paradise: Searching for Sarm
programme.desc: Tir Dhondy searches for the yacht Sarm vanished from, and tracks down Ryan Banes ex-wife, hearing first-hand about her experiences while married to him

In the Teeny Tiny Task, Rory, Sandy and Zoe make their legs grow with the help of some stilts, as they discover what its like having long legs like a crane fly!

programme.title: The King of Queens

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Doug discovers Carrie used to have a crush on his dentist - who he is convinced is deliberately making his root canal operation as painful as possible. Comedy, starring Kevin James

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray and Robert both want to keep a stray bulldog that Ray brings home. It reminds Ray of a dog he had to give up as a child, but it turns out that the cute canine is not so stray after all. Comedy, starring Ray Romano

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: The neighbours are upset by the antics of Rays parents and gather at his house to thrash out a solution, but their meeting is gatecrashed by the troublesome pair

programme.title: Frasier

When lust blooms, the teachers aggressive performance techniques cannot help but remind the psychiatrist of his old gym teacher. Comedy, guest starring Jeanne Tripplehorn and Bob Hoskins, with Kelsey Grammer

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Daphnes mother infuriates Martin by meddling in his romantic affairs, while Frasier and Niles take part in a charity cycling event - even though neither of them knows how to ride a bike

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Martin dispenses advice to a depressed Kenny, leaving Frasier feeling jealous, and a yoga class goes badly for Niles, who is taken aback to discover he is not as supple as Daphne. Guest starring Alan Cumming

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The Crane brothers are delighted when their social standing grows thanks to a Russian caviar dealer, who offers them good quality roe at knock-down prices. Daphne tries to persuade a reluctant Martin to return $40 dispensed in error by a cash machine

programme.title: American Pickers

Day two sees Heather and Gareth from The Gate take the dining experience to a whole new level, with a classic menu of seafood and steak. Finally, its the turn of Sian and Joel from the Horse and Jockey to bring some country gastro pub fayre

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon OBrien search for more items to fix up and sell on, visiting Windsor to meet Pete and Phil, who rent out cars to the film and TV business. Henry finds an Austrian moped which is missing an engine, while Simon picks a fibreglass suit of armour

programme.title: Countdown

With Gill already retired and Rhys soon to follow, they are looking to fulfil their dream of leaving the UK and moving to Bergerac in the Dordogne countryside. Armed with a budget of £190,000, Craig tries to find the perfect property for them

programme.title: Help! We Bought a Village
programme.desc: In Spain, Michael battles decades of decay in the mountains. Bulgaria becomes a lonely place for Carrie and Ross, who are trying to save a settlement that nature has consumed. Ken and Pauline try to safeguard the future of their entire French village, and Lolly and Sean herald a new era at a forgotten hamlet

programme.title: Jasmine Harmans Renovation in the Sun
programme.desc: The property expert and her family continue their transformation of a run-down Spanish villa. Despite Jons accident, the building work continues as Jasmines father comes over from London to help with the decorating, and fellow presenter Laura Hamilton tries to lift Jasmines spirits with a trip into Málaga. Later, son Albion gets to see his finished bedroom - will he like it?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Although theyve never visited Malta before, Alan and Caroline are looking for a holiday home that will hopefully become their permanent abode. In a region of clear blue seas, rich history and gorgeous climate, Ben Hillman shows them what their maximum budget of £405,000 can secure - from a daunting doer-upper to a luscious limestone blue-shuttered beauty

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather

programme.title: George Clarkes Homes in the Wild
programme.desc: The architect travels to the windswept shores of Bruny Island in Australia, off Tasmanias coast, to meet the people whove chosen a life of isolation, beauty and resilience. He visits a working sheep farm where the homes design is deeply influenced by the very wool it produces. Next, he steps into a serene Japanese-inspired cabin, crafted to honour simplicity and the quiet rituals of daily life. Finally, George is transported to another realm entirely, as he explores a science-fiction-inspired dome that feels like a home from another planet

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: All five competitors remain in with a chance of winning Greg Davies glittering bonce. Efficient assistant Alex Horne shows off his jockey silks in the weighing room, while Maisie Adam makes sexy use of a feather boa and shin pads. Ania Magliano and Phil Ellis cause calamity with a tower of bricks, Sanjeev Bhaskar watches a croissant float by and Reece Shearsmith pays homage to the dawn of cinema

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The three finalists bake a classic British iced bun in the signature, a tower of French delights in the technical and for their showstopper take on the challenge of making the largest ever cake in Bake Off history. As ever, Alison Hammond and Noel Fielding encourage the bakers, while judges Paul Hollywood and Prue Leith taste their efforts - but only one can be crowned winner of The Great British Bake Off 2025

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts a hybrid of the comedy panel show and words-and-numbers quiz, as Jon Richardson and Rosie Jones take on Joe Wilkinson and Phil Wang. Mathematician Rachel Riley looks after the letters and numbers, while Dr John Cooper Clarke joins lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner

programme.title: Jimmy Carrs I Literally Just Told You
programme.sub-title: I Literally Just Told You with Jimmy Carr
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts this game show in which contestants are given every answer with the questions written, literally, as the show is happening. With each correct answer adding to their prize pot up to a maximum of £25,000, the competitors have to keep their focus and remember the things theyve seen and heard just minutes before. In the dramatic finale, the remaining two contestants set each other questions

programme.title: Ramsays Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits the Beachfront Inn and Inlet, a Caribbean-style resort hotel in Fort Pierce, Florida. Young and inexperienced owner Brian is making guests time at the hotel miserable with dusty rooms, late-night concerts and poor service. Can Gordon prevent the business from going under?

programme.title: Iris Prize Best British Shorts
programme.sub-title: Iris Prize Best British Shorts: Kinship
programme.desc: A selection of films nominated for the prestigious 2025 Iris Prize for Best British Short, deconstructing the different forms that connection can take. The films in this collection are The Second Time Around directed by Jack Howard, Meat Raffle directed by Stuart Armstrong, Solers United directed by Sara Harrak, Trailblazers directed by Sobia Bushra and Purebred directed by Caleb J Roberts. The themes touch upon one womans reflection, paternal anxieties, sisterhood in sport, South Asian queer joy, a complicated conversation and a glamorous visitor

programme.title: Unreported World
programme.sub-title: Guns and Cocaine: Colombias Narco Wars
programme.desc: After a 2016 peace deal following a 50-year civil war, Colombia has once again become engulfed in violence, as guerrilla groups battle for control of coca fields and lucrative smuggling routes. In the past year alone, more than 50,000 people have been forced from their homes and civilians face the daily threat of killings, forced recruitment and displacement. Guillermo Galdos travels deep into the Catatumbo region to understand the fight for cocaine production and gains rare access to Colombias special forces as they launch operations against guerrilla fighters

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Sunday Brunch
programme.desc: Some extra brunch, as Tim Lovejoy and Simon Rimmer host the food and chat show

Back then, they had just one toddler and two dogs and their two-bed semi was bursting at the seams. Ian wanted to move on, but Sarah was determined to stay, convinced their home had the potential to cater for a growing family. Now, Phil returns to find out what happened next

programme.title: The King of Queens

LA is a self-declared sanctuary city and supposedly a safe haven for migrants, but across the country, US Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) is targeting 11 million undocumented migrants and is tasked to make 3,000 arrests a day, the impact of which is being felt up and down Los Angeles - where nearly half the residents are Latino

programme.desc: Its March 2025 and the Tower is preparing to launch an ambitious display to celebrate the 80th anniversary of VE day, the end of the Second World War in Europe. They will be bringing back nearly 30,000 ceramic poppies to the Fortress. Cameras also focus on Buildings Curator Alfred Hawkins, who is beginning an excavation at Henry VIIIs chapel of St Peter ad Vincula

It was rediscovered, overgrown by jungle, more than 100 years ago. Now Dan explores its story and comes face to face with an Inca ice mummy - a teenage girl frozen in time when she was sacrificed to the mountain gods 600 years ago

programme.title: Police: Night Shift 999
programme.desc: The first call of the night for the Gloucestershire officers is to an RTC in the rural country lanes, where the driver has misjudged a corner and her car has landed on its roof. programme.desc: East Anglia is the setting as another three couples try to prove they are the best when it comes to throwing a dinner party. programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Farm dwellers Nikki and Clive kick off the contest in East Anglia, serving up a menu of rustic fare. They are followed by young couple Lloyd and Molly, who serve up a Thai menu, and bringing up the rear are Pete and Kirsty, with an evening themed around the letter P. Gordon finds owner Tinas work to save the eatery from oblivion is frequently ruined by the behaviour of her brother, a tyrannical front-of-house manager whose violent temper constantly undermines staff morale

programme.title: Friday Night Dinner
programme.desc: Continuing the third series of Robert Poppers award-winning comedy about the Goodmans family gatherings. Dad has been secretly hiding a dead fox in the outside freezer as he wants to get it stuffed, but when Mum almost finds out, he enlists the help of Adam and Jonny to stash the carcass elsewhere. Tracy-Ann Oberman (best known for her role as Chrissie Watts in EastEnders) makes her third appearance as Aunty Val, starring alongside Simon Bird, Paul Ritter, Tamsin Greig, Tom Rosenthal and Mark Heap

programme.title: Friday Night Dinner
programme.desc: Continuing the third series of Robert Poppers award-winning comedy about the Goodmans Friday night gatherings. The family is distraught when Grandma gets engaged to Mr Morris, her horrible 85-year-old boyfriend who upset everyone and lost his temper the first time he came for dinner in 2012. Dad couldnt stand him back then and hid in his shed, but will they get along this time? Meanwhile, Jim collects money for charity dressed in a dog costume that doesnt leave out any detail. Starring Simon Bird, Tom Rosenthal, Tamsin Greig, Paul Ritter and Mark Heap, with Frances Cuka and Harry Landis

programme.title: Taskmaster Bleeped
programme.desc: With Dara Ó Briain holding a very slender lead in the race to claim televisions most prestigious prize, this penultimate episode finds John Kearns blunting the business end of a sausage, Fern Brady struggling with a raspberry and Munya Chawawa unwittingly forcing Sarah Millican into finding a novel use for a ping-pong ball. Greg Davies hosts, ably assisted by Alex Horne

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats
programme.desc: Guests including comedians Johnny Vegas and Joe Lycett join the irreverent panel show hosted by Jimmy Carr. programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.sub-title: The Hunt for the Great Albino Pumpkin

programme.title: The Goldbergs

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Part one of two. programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef tries to reverse the fortunes of the Mixing Bowl diner in Bellmore, New York, where a talented cooks work is being undone by the managers marketing plans - putting the finances in dire straits

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Oxfordshire, amateur MC James and his partner Heather have every confidence in their French-influenced food, which they follow with a basement rave. However, there is a frosty atmosphere between guests barmaid Marjie and partner Matt, and refined farming couple Sonja and Tutty. The second day sees Marjie and Matt stage an evening themed on the Titanic, but their `chilly" soup proves a bit too spicy for one guest. Finally, Tutty and Sonja try to secure the £1,000 prize with their refined countryside dining

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Sherry and her partner Phil kick-off the contest in Oxfordshire, with a traditional menu with a modern twist served in their grand dining room. On the final night, Zahra and Conall plan to impress their guests with plates of perfectly presented food. Old smoothie Phil gives romance-shirking Conall a few lessons in love, before a few embarrassing pet names and the £1,000 prize winners are revealed

programme.title: Dont Tell the Bride
programme.desc: Professional wrestler Mike takes sole charge of planning his wedding to fiancee Becky. The bride-to-be dreams of a stylish, elegant ceremony, but her groom wants to spend their £12,000 budget on a celebration devoted to his sport

programme.title: Dont Tell the Bride
programme.desc: Joker Lee plans a huge wedding for his pregnant bride-to-be Ellie, showing off his sense of humour and celebrating his dwarfism with a fairy tale Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs theme. programme.title: Undercover Boss USA

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues to explore Alaska, from the remote former goldrush settlement of Talkeetna to the railwayless state capital, Juneau. Along the way, he helps a homesteader fell a tree to clear land for a log cabin, discovers how 100 years ago photographers captured the beauty of the Alaskan landscape and meets scientists studying the Northern Lights

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: Ben Robinson visits Laxey on the Isle of Man to discover what drew Victorians to the tourist destination. It wasnt the beaches and the mountains that attracted Victorian tourists, but an engineering marvel - the biggest waterwheel in the world

programme.title: The Smallest Show on Earth
programme.desc: A newly married couple inherit a dilapidated cinema and its incompetent staff and resolve to transform its fortunes. They soon find, however, that their hopes for the future are far more difficult to realise than anticipated. Basil Deardens comedy, starring Bill Travers, Virginia McKenna, Peter Sellers, Margaret Rutherford, Bernard Miles and Leslie Phillips

programme.title: Dead of Night
programme.desc: A group of people gather at a country house where their supernatural stories become all too real for one of the guests, who realises theyre all part of his recurring nightmare. Horror anthology, starring Mervyn Johns, Michael Redgrave and Googie Withers

programme.title: Anzio
programme.desc: An American war correspondent joins Allied troops in 1944 as they prepare for their landing in Italy. A strategic blunder by their commanding officer gives German forces time to reinforce the area, leaving the reporter caught up in one of the campaigns fiercest battles. Second World War drama, starring Robert Mitchum, Peter Falk, Arthur Kennedy, Robert Ryan and Earl Holliman

programme.title: Dr Who and the Daleks
programme.desc: The eccentric time-traveller journeys to the Daleks home world, which has been devastated by their nuclear weapons. He enters their city and finds them engaged in a plot to exterminate their peaceful humanoid enemies the Thals. Sci-fi adventure based on the TV series, starring Peter Cushing, Roy Castle, Jennie Linden and Roberta Tovey

programme.title: Jumanji: The Next Level
programme.desc: Players of Jumanji return, but as they attempt to rescue one of their own, they will have to brave parts unknown from arid deserts to snowy mountains, to escape the worlds most dangerous game. Director Jake Kasdans fantasy adventure sequel to his 2017 rebooted hit Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle, starring Dwayne Johnson, Karen Gillan, Kevin Hart and Jack Black

programme.title: Braveheart
programme.desc: Account of the life of medieval Scottish hero William Wallace. After the slaughter of his father and brother, young Wallace is taken in by his uncle, who teaches him how to use not only his brawn but his brain - which he employs to great effect years later when he resolves to drive the English out of Scotland. Oscar-winning historical epic, directed by and starring Mel Gibson. With Patrick McGoohan, Sophie Marceau and Catherine McCormack

programme.title: The Mission
programme.desc: The missionary work of Jesuit priests in 18th-century Brazil is threatened by the activities of unscrupulous colonial merchants and rival factions within the Church, leading to a series of tense confrontations which not only endanger their lives but also their faith. Historical drama, starring Robert De Niro, Jeremy Irons, Cherie Lunghi and Ray McAnally

programme.title: Rio Grande
programme.desc: A cavalry officer has to avoid showing preferential treatment when the son he has not seen for 15 years is posted to his fort as a cadet. His estranged wife also turns up wanting to take the boy away, but he is forced to put duty before his family when called on to rescue children kidnapped by Apaches on the Mexican border. John Fords Western, with John Wayne, Maureen OHara, Ben Johnson and J Carrol Naish

programme.title: The Caine Mutiny
programme.desc: US Navy officers rebel against their ships erratic captain during a violent storm at sea, only to face a court martial back on dry land. However, the crews actions seem to have been justified when evidence questioning the mental stability of their superior is produced. Second World War drama based on Herman Wouks novel, starring Humphrey Bogart, Jose Ferrer, Fred MacMurray and Van Johnson

programme.title: Last Night in Soho Interview Special
programme.desc: Director Edgar Wright and co-writer Krysty Wilson-Cairns discuss travelling through time and recreating the past to make the atmospheric psychological thriller Last Night in Soho

programme.title: Far from the Madding Crowd
programme.desc: A beautiful woman arouses the ardour of three rival suitors in 19th-century rural Dorset and, having flirted and toyed with their affections, she chooses to marry a caddish, gambling soldier - a decision that leads to a sequence of harrowing events. John Schlesingers adaptation of Thomas Hardys classic novel, with Julie Christie, Alan Bates, Terence Stamp and Peter Finch

programme.title: Jerry and Marge Go Large
programme.desc: A couple discover a mathematical loophole in the Massachusetts lottery and win millions to revive and rejuvenate their small town. Comedy drama based on a true story, starring Bryan Cranston, Annette Bening, Rainn Wilson and Larry Wilmore

programme.title: Prey
programme.desc: In 1719 on the Northern Great Plains, Comanche tracker Naru undertakes a rite of passage to slay a ferocious predator. During a fierce tussle with a mountain lion, Naru glimpses strange lights in the treeline: a warning that a highly evolved, otherworldly creature with cloaking technology and explosive armaments is at large on the plains. Sci-fi thriller, starring Amber Midthunder and Dakota Beavers. Directed by Dan Trachtenberg, who also helmed recent franchise offerings Predator: Killer of Killers, and Predator: Badlands

programme.title: Attack the Block
programme.desc: A student nurse living in a south London tower block escapes a dangerous encounter with a teenage gang when aliens invade. As the creatures cause mayhem throughout the estate, she joins forces with her would-be attackers to fight off the extraterrestrial forces. Sci-fi comedy thriller, with Jodie Whittaker, John Boyega and Nick Frost

programme.title: Save Yourselves!
programme.desc: A young Brooklyn couple head to a remote upstate cabin to unplug from their phones and reconnect with each other. Blissfully unaware of their surroundings, they are left to their own devices as the planet falls under attack. Sci-fi comedy, starring Sunita Mani, John Reynolds and Ben Sinclair

programme.title: Lola
programme.desc: In 1940, two friends build a machine that can intercept radio and television broadcasts from the future. Co-writer/director Andrew Legges sci-fi drama, starring Emma Appleton and Stefanie Martini

programme.title: Waterloo
programme.desc: Napoleon returns from exile on Elba and regains control of the French army in a bid to reclaim his empire and depose the king. Meanwhile, the Duke of Wellington marshals the allied forces for the fateful battle to come and the day that will change the course of history. Drama, with Rod Steiger, Christopher Plummer, Orson Welles, Jack Hawkins, Dan OHerlihy, Michael Wilding and Virginia McKenna

programme.title: War of the Worlds
programme.desc: A divorced fathers rare weekend with his two estranged children descends into horror when alien war machines rise from beneath Earth and begin to systematically destroy every human being in their path - leaving the man with the dangerous task of getting his kids to safety. Steven Spielbergs sci-fi thriller, based on HG Wells novel, with Tom Cruise, Dakota Fanning, Justin Chatwin, Miranda Otto and Tim Robbins

programme.desc: Two bumbling police officers working in the evidence room of a Las Vegas station are surprised to discover a bail receipt for an unusually high sum of money. programme.title: Little House on the Prairie

programme.title: Born and Bred
programme.desc: The villagers of Ormston close ranks as civil servant Mr Ffotherington arrives to assess their objections to the new road, but when he insinuates that he could influence the decision, the residents fall over themselves to keep him sweet. However, Mr Boynton and Rev Brewer begin to suspect there is more to the official than meets the eye. programme.desc: Sidney has lost his faith in the church, so decides to resign so he can marry Amanda. His decision is a crushing blow to Mrs Maguire, while Leonard fears the arrival of a less tolerant vicar. Sidney soon finds the community needs him more than ever when a boy is abducted, while Geordies behaviour grows more and more unstable as he wrestles with family problems. As the divided vicar grows closer to the truth about the missing child, he is forced to choose between love, faith, and loyalty to his troubled friend

programme.title: Cracker
programme.sub-title: To Be a Somebody - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of three. Time is running out and Fitz is convinced the legend of Albie Kinsella is set to come true, but the police are unhappy about gambling their resources on a manhunt, allowing the killer to turn his attention to a tabloid journalist. Robert Carlyle guest stars, with Robbie Coltrane, Christopher Eccleston and Geraldine Somerville

programme.title: Cracker
programme.sub-title: To Be a Somebody - Part Three
programme.desc: Part three of three. Following DCI Bilboroughs murder, the team hunts for Albie with renewed passion, while newly installed DCI Wise brings in Fitz to defuse a potentially tragic situation. Drama, starring Robbie Coltrane

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: An accident at the harbour leaves a fisherman worried for the future of his family when Burnett is forced to amputate his hand. Weatherill treats a woman admitted with pneumonia who is deeply concerned about her fathers presence around her daughter. Ken bids a final farewell to the Royal, but Lizzies resolve crumbles at the last minute. Michael Starke, Amy Robbins and Michelle Hardwick star

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Lexi wakes up in jail, and although Carrie is trying to arrange her release, its Carl who manages it. Louise tries to win back Jamie, and Lisa voices her concerns about Sam.

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Jamie launches a search for a missing rabbit, but Paddy and Marlon make a worrying discovery in the woods. Jimmy and Carrie kiss, but the moment is interrupted.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Gossip is rife about Caseys behaviour, and a row breaks out in the Rovers when Ashley thinks Kevin is spying on him. Carla gloats to Sally about Rosie accepting a full-time job.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Steve starts to feel smug about winning back Michelle, so Eileen decides to have more fun with the holiday photos. Audrey confronts Ashley about his relationship with Casey.

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: A schoolgirl is found dead after a disco, and Cornish copper Charles Wycliffe applies himself to the task of discovering whether she was murdered or committed suicide. Jack Shepherd and Helen Masters star

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Eric Fogle is appointed as new head porter, putting Aluns nose out of joint. The hospital receives a letter of resignation from Dr Banner in Australia and has to appoint a partner to the practice - Weatherill believes she knows just the person, but Dr Ormerod favours Dr Burnett. Elsewhere, when Lucy Bayliss is involved in a horse-riding accident an X-ray reveals a more long-term problem. With Berwick Kaler and guest star Claire King

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: The County Sheepdog Trials take place at Ashfordly Hall, and it soon becomes clear that even such a prestigious event can bring out the worst in some people. Meanwhile, Vernon tries to cash in by organising the toilet facilities for the event - but his money-making dreams soon go down the pan

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Abandoned by his wife and faced with financial ruin, local farmer Richard Harvey finally reaches the end of his tether, and heads into Aidensfield to air his grievances in a particularly memorable way. Meanwhile, the arrival of a handsome stranger sets Ginas heart racing - but he could be a dangerous criminal. Vernon and David branch out into a new line of business, and soon manage to pep up a few palates with Aunt Beths tangy horseradish sauce

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Grays concern for his mother upsets Perdy so she seeks solace in the arms of Matthew. Scarletts furious with Carrie and Louise and Jamie prepare to announce they are together.

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: After finding a negative pregnancy test in the bin Perdy decides to leave Gray to be with Matthew. Jasmine meets with Miles to convince him to fight Nicola.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: David is stood up by Mel when Sarah reveals some home truths about his past behaviour. Cilla begins work at the care home and Kevin implores Ashley not to turn his back on Claire

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Paul pricks Leannes interest when he seems strangely calm when she confides in him about the restaurants perilous financial state. David lies about why he split up with Mel

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: While Britain feels the winds of change swept in by a new Labour government in 1924, Downtons residents - both above and below stairs - are undergoing alterations too. After mourning the death of his beloved wife Lady Sybil for four years, Branson decides its time he got on with his life, although Robert isnt comfortable about the ex-chauffeurs relationship with local teacher Sarah Bunting. Mary is also ready for love again - but which of her beaus is her Mr Right? Meanwhile, Edith struggles to cope with being parted from her baby, Jimmy receives unwanted female attention and plans for a war memorial cause tension

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: The doctor has his second GMC assessment - mock surgery - and Buddy is missing. Meanwhile, Kens arrival does not bring good news for Al and Bert, and Penhale unhappy with the arrival of his predecessor, Mark Mylow, who tries to take charge of his investigation. Starring Martin Clunes, Caroline Catz and Ian McNeice

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Bellamy thinks hes pulled off quite a coup when he spies a dangerous armed robber, but the villain makes his escape and embarks on a desperate hunt for a fast car to steal. Meanwhile, Mertons singer-songwriter cousin arrives, looking for the peace and quiet she needs to work, but her pregnant daughter soon puts paid to that idea. Lulu guest stars

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Local landowner Les Parnaby loses patience with ramblers wandering across his land and resolves to take matters into his own hands - regardless of the cost. Meanwhile, Ventresss car accident has a strange effect on Vernon Scripps, much to the delight of his many creditors. Rural police drama, starring Lloyd McGuire, Geoffrey Hughes and Tricia Penrose

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: As darkness covers Midsomer Stanton during a total eclipse of the sun, Jeremy Harper is killed by a blow to the head with a meteorite. The victim was a leading light in the village - an amateur astronomer who was passionate about preserving Moonstone Ridge, a Bronze Age heritage site housing a 1930s observatory. Barnaby and Jones are called in to investigate, and the duo discover that intrigue, sexual tension and academic rivalry are rife among the local stargazing community. Murder mystery, guest starring Maureen Lipman and Kenny Ireland, with Neil Dudgeon and Jason Hughes

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: The year 1956 finds jazz-loving clergyman Sidney Chambers attending a talk by Reverend Nathaniel Todd, a member of the formative US civil rights movement. During the event, protestors disrupt the speech and release fireworks, causing the audience to panic. In the chaos, Todds son Charles is stabbed and killed by an unseen assailant. The murder sees racial tensions spike and Geordie Keating is called in to investigate. Things are further complicated when Sidney finds himself drawn to passionate young activist, and their tentative romance faces pressure from all sides. Robson Green stars, with James Norton, Tessa Peake-Jones, Samuel West and Paterson Joseph

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: With Violet gone, Sidney loses himself in drink. After a heavy whiskey session leaves him without his jacket - and little memory of the night before - he discovers to his horror that he was the last person to see a young woman alive. As he struggles to remember her final words, Geordie grows concerned - both for the murdered girl, so callously abandoned outside a local slum, and for his friends troubled state of mind. James Norton stars, with Robson Green, Tessa Peake-Jones, Al Weaver and Kacey Ainsworth

programme.title: Cracker
programme.desc: Part one of three. Police psychologist Fitz comes face to face with the dark underbelly of suburbia while investigating the disappearance of a teenage girl mixed up in a bizarre religious cult. Crime drama, starring Robbie Coltrane, Jim Carter and Geraldine Somerville

programme.title: Cracker
programme.desc: Part two of three. Schoolmaster Kenneth Trant and his family become increasingly desperate to save themselves as their perfect crime starts to unravel. Meanwhile, Fitzs fears for teenager Joanne prove justified. Starring Robbie Coltrane, Geraldine Somerville, Jim Carter and Samantha Morton

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo heads to Northern Irelands spectacular Causeway coast to begin a new journey, which takes him along the north and east coasts through Ulster and Leinster. He begins in Co Derry on the windswept shores of Loch Foyle, where the largest accumulation of coastal sands in Ireland has formed a system of dunes visible from space. He also learns how scientists are monitoring the site and hears how their work has been picked up by fellow scientists in the United States to help research the surface of Mars

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys

At the medieval Carrickfergus Castle, Michael learns of the towns important role in the history of Ireland, when William of Orange landed at its harbour and went on to fight the Battle of the Boyne, which is commemorated by Unionists to this day

programme.desc: A ruthless art gallery owner gets a new companion, who also happens to be a talented artist. Drama, starring Richard Johnson and Victoria Tennant

programme.title: Alfred Hitchcock Presents
programme.desc: An antiques dealer comes up with a plan to raise money to pay off a loan, but things truns out not to be easy for the shop owner the second time around

programme.title: Alfred Hitchcock Presents
programme.desc: Karen finds herself in a cell for committing murder with no recollection of how or why she ended up in there after an argument with her boyfriend

programme.title: The Great Songwriters
programme.desc: Steve Earle discusses songwriting and his life in music, and performs a selection of songs, including Copperhead Road and Goodbye

programme.title: Opry Live
programme.sub-title: Jamey Johnson, Randy Houser, Megan Moroney, Ernest
programme.desc: Performances from Nashville music venue the Grand Ole Opry House, featuring Jamey Johnson, Randy Houser, Megan Moroney and Ernest

programme.title: Simon and Garfunkel: Old Friends - Live on Stage
programme.desc: A 2003 concert by the duo at Madison Square Garden in New York City, featuring a guest appearance by the Everly Brothers

programme.title: Down the Tracks: The Music That Influenced Bob Dylan
programme.desc: Records and artists that inspired the singer during his formative years, including Pete Seeger, Blind Willie McTell and Harry Smiths Anthology of American Folk Music

programme.title: Bob Dylan: The Other Side of the Mirror
programme.desc: Murray Lerners film documenting Bob Dylans appearances at the Newport Folk Festival in Rhode Island from 1963 to 1965, revealing a metamorphosis from folk prodigy to rocks fiercely confrontational poet

programme.title: Classic Albums
programme.sub-title: Elton John - Goodbye Yellow Brick Road
programme.desc: Elton John discusses the making of his chart-topping 1973 album Goodbye Yellow Brick Road, while lyricist Bernie Taupin adds a personal insight into how the songs were written

programme.title: Richard E Grants Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The actor returns to explore more of the worlds most luxurious hotels and begins in Miamis South Beach, home to some of the most hedonistic and extravagant establishments in America. At the Fontainebleau, he meets a man with eye-opening stories about Frank Sinatras regular visits and gets a shock when he discovers how much it costs to hire a booth in the night club. Richard also gatecrashes swimwear fashion week at the Raleigh Hotel, where he speaks to the event manager about the many celebrity parties he has organised

programme.title: The Guest Wing
programme.desc: The Penningtons, owners of Muncaster Castle in the Lake District, discuss the challenges of housing three generations of their family under one roof, while elderly patriarch Patrick struggles to find new purpose following the death of his wife. At Maunsel House in Somerset, Sir Benjamin Slades preconceptions are challenged when a gay mens choir arrives for a weekend break

programme.title: Julia
programme.desc: After receiving an invitation from the White House, the WGBH crew travels down to Washington DC for a chance to film inside the presidents own kitchen

programme.title: Julia
programme.desc: When the FBI descends on WGBH, Julia uses her experience in wartime espionage to keep the crew safe from false accusations of un-American conduct, but a shocking announcement could shape the future of The French Chef

programme.title: Homicide: Life on the Street
programme.desc: When a four-year-old boy disappears from a carousel, Falsone and Stivers catch the case and are joined by the entire homicide unit

programme.title: Homicide: Life on the Street
programme.desc: Detectives Munch and Gharty investigate the case of a basketball star found shot dead, and find themselves wondering whether he really was the wholesome character he appeared. Meanwhile, Pembleton and Bayliss crack an old case and Kellerman receives good news for a change

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: As the Starks prepare to fight, Davos loses something dear, while Ramsay plays a game and Daenerys faces a choice

programme.title: My Brilliant Friend
programme.desc: After her daughter is born, Elena is consumed with jealousy when Nino and Lila step in to take Immacolata to the hospital. In Italian

programme.title: Band of Brothers
programme.desc: Tom Hanks and Steven Spielbergs drama recounting the Second World War actions of crack US paratroop unit Easy Company, whose daring exploits made them American heroes. The saga begins in 1942 as a group of volunteers begins regimental training under the harsh leadership of Captain Sobel. The rivalry between Sobel and a respected junior officer comes to the fore. David Schwimmer and Damian Lewis star

programme.title: Band of Brothers
programme.desc: Winters rallies the troops during the horrendous confusion of the Normandy landings, and helps many stricken soldiers relocate their units. He is later chosen to lead an attack on a fortified German artillery position, where he faces his first test as company commander. Damian Lewis and Donnie Wahlberg star

programme.title: Homicide: Life on the Street
programme.desc: Two women are found strangled, and evidence shows that on the night of their death they were bought drinks by a married couple

programme.title: Homicide: Life on the Street
programme.desc: The detectives suspect foul play when two prominent businessmen commit suicide. Richard Belzer stars

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: King Joffreys days on the Iron Throne appear to be numbered as Stannis lays claim to his late brother Roberts realm with a naval assault on Kings Landing. The realities of all-out war leave the young tyrant reeling, and it is left to his sharp-witted uncle Tyrion to launch a defensive strategy that could save his family and decide the fate of the seven battle-scarred kingdoms of Westeros. Jack Gleeson, Peter Dinklage and Stephen Dillane star in an episode written by George RR Martin, whose novels form the basis for the series

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Theon Greyjoy stirs his men into action as Maester Luwin offers some final advice, Arya receives a gift from the mysterious Jaqen, and Daenerys summons the courage to enter the House of the Undying. Meanwhile, Jon proves his worth as a brother of the Nights Watch to Qhorin Halfhand. Fantasy drama, based on George RR Martins Song of Ice and Fire novels, and starring Maisie Williams, Kit Harington and Alfie Allen

programme.title: The Iris Affair
programme.desc: Devastated by a setback, Iris makes a stand, while Camerons benefactor steps up control of his project

programme.title: Sweetpea
programme.desc: With Julia locked in the garage, Rhiannon sets out to prove shes not the loser she once was, until a revelation changes everything

programme.title: The Sopranos
programme.desc: Tony receives a retirement request from one of his associates, and decides to share his recent windfall with Carmela. Later, he is taken on a backyard treasure hunt by Junior, while Hesh seeks revenge against a wrongdoing involving his son-in-law. Starring James Gandolfini

programme.title: Banshee
programme.desc: Siobhan is torn between exposing Lucas and keeping his secret, and Brock discovers his ex, Emily, is working as a caregiver for Proctors mother. Drama, starring Antony Starr

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: In Kings Landing, Sansa grows in confidence under the watchful eye of the Machiavellian Lord Baelish, while Tyrion is after his just reward for the part he played in the Battle of the Blackwater. In the far North, Jon Snow is brought before formidable wildling leader Mance Rayder (Ciaran Hinds) and attempts to earn the trust of the King-beyond-the-Wall. Across the Narrow Sea, Daenerys Targaryen arrives in Slavers Bay with adviser Ser Jorah Mormont looking to form an army. Fantasy drama based on George RR Martins A Song of Ice and Fire series of novels, starring Peter Dinklage, Emilia Clarke and Kit Harington

programme.title: All Her Fault
programme.desc: Marissa Irvine arrives to collect her young son Milo from his first playdate, but the woman who answers the door isnt a mother she recognises, doesnt have Milo and has never heard of him. Mystery thriller based on the book by Andrea Mara, starring Sarah Snook, with Jake Lacy, Dakota Fanning and Michael Peña

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: In Kings Landing, Shae sneaks into Tyrions chamber to tell him Ros warned her about Baelishs interest in Sansa, who goes to tea with Margaery and her grandmother Lady Olenna and is encouraged to speak freely about Joffrey. Jaime passes the time by taunting his escort Brienne, Arya encounters outlaw group the Brotherhood Without Banners, while Lord Karstark makes Robb aware he no longer has faith in him. Fantasy drama, guest starring Diana Rigg

programme.title: Urban Secrets
programme.desc: Alan Cumming tours the less-celebrated sights of Brighton, beginning by visiting the Toy and Model Museum to look at its collection of model trains. He then discovers a boutique that sells a variety of unusual items, before taking a glimpse behind the scenes at the Royal Pavilion

programme.title: Urban Secrets
programme.desc: Alan Cumming explores the history of Bristol, beginning by learning a grisly secret at the docks before meeting Mercury Prize-winning musician Roni Size to discuss life in the St Pauls and Stokes Croft areas of the city. He also explores the district of Clifton and visits a speakeasy-style bar

programme.title: Richard E Grants Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: In this edition the actor explores the luxury hotels of Hong Kong. Home to more skyscrapers than any other city, he first checks in to the Mandarin in the financial district, before experiencing the Four Seasons, the only hotel with two Michelin three-star resturants, as well as the timeless Peninsula in Kowloon, which even provides a Rolls-Royce airport taxi service. He ends his stay at the Ritz-Carlton, home to the worlds highest swimming pool

programme.title: The Guest Wing
programme.desc: At Northumberlands Chillingham Castle, Sir Humphrey Wakefield prepares to hand over the estate to his apprehensive son Maximilian. Hard-working staff at Carlton Towers in North Yorkshire get ready for the arrival of 120 caravan owners for the annual rally and dinner dance

programme.title: Band of Brothers
programme.desc: Tom Hanks and Steven Spielbergs drama recounting the Second World War actions of crack US paratroop unit Easy Company, whose daring exploits made them American heroes. The saga begins in 1942 as a group of volunteers begins regimental training under the harsh leadership of Captain Sobel. The rivalry between Sobel and a respected junior officer comes to the fore. David Schwimmer and Damian Lewis star

He is later chosen to lead an attack on a fortified German artillery position, where he faces his first test as company commander. Damian Lewis and Donnie Wahlberg star

programme.title: Homicide: Life on the Street
programme.desc: Two women are found strangled, and evidence shows that on the night of their death they were bought drinks by a married couple

programme.title: Homicide: Life on the Street
programme.desc: The detectives suspect foul play when two prominent businessmen commit suicide. Richard Belzer stars

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: As Cersei awaits judgement, Walder Frey and Jaime celebrate at Riverrun. Meanwhile, winter finally arrives. Lena Headey, Peter Dinklage and Emilia Clarke star

programme.title: My Brilliant Friend
programme.desc: After a tragic loss and stunned by Ninos actions yet again, Elena takes refuge at Lilas and finally learns the truth about him. In Italian

programme.title: Band of Brothers
programme.desc: Two days after D-Day, Easy Company is ordered to take the town of Carentan, a battle that results in casualties despite its apparent success. The battalion is finally sent to England after 36 days in Normandy, but the respite proves short-lived as the orders come to move out again

programme.title: Band of Brothers
programme.desc: After a string of heavy casualties, a group of inexperienced paratroopers joins Easy Company in time for the massive Operation Market Garden. Aimed at invading Germany via Holland, the mission goes well until a combined force of American troops and British tanks runs into superior German opposition

programme.title: Homicide: Life on the Street
programme.desc: Bayliss is still having nightmares about his first murder case, so Gee is reluctant to assign the case of another girl murdered in 1932 to him

programme.title: Homicide: Life on the Street
programme.desc: Part one of two. Pembleton and Bayliss investigate the murder of a prominent judge connected to the Mahoney organisation. Junior Bunk is brought in for questioning, but the team are surprised by his cavalier attitude

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: In Kings Landing, Sansa grows in confidence under the watchful eye of the Machiavellian Lord Baelish, while Tyrion is after his just reward for the part he played in the Battle of the Blackwater. In the far North, Jon Snow is brought before formidable wildling leader Mance Rayder (Ciaran Hinds) and attempts to earn the trust of the King-beyond-the-Wall. Across the Narrow Sea, Daenerys Targaryen arrives in Slavers Bay with adviser Ser Jorah Mormont looking to form an army. Fantasy drama based on George RR Martins A Song of Ice and Fire series of novels, starring Peter Dinklage, Emilia Clarke and Kit Harington
